data.title: OMG
data.text: I am not usually that fussy but this place is dirty, run down, noisy. Would not take off my shoes. Out of choices at breakfast.   Better hotels in the area. Thank God my wife was not with me. She would have walked out.

data.title: Average
data.text:
I have stayed here twice in the last 6 weeks while on business.  The rooms are fine and I don't have any real complaints for the money.  It is quiet and has internet and a free breakfast.  

I would stay again for the money.

data.title: Worst hotel I've ever stayed at
data.text: Our team stayed here in late May for the State Swimming Championships. The beds were hard and you could feel the springs poking through the mattress. The doors were cracked and our bathroom door wouldn't close all the way. They only gave one room key and charged $50.00 for a replacement! As for cleanliness in my room, the box springs on the bed were stained with food and drinks. The carpets were very old and not vacummed. The bathroom floor hadn't been mopped. There was hair and dirt all along the walls. There was a dead bird in the dining room. As for safety, the heat lamp on the bathroom ceiling didn't have a cover and was very outdated. In one of the rooms it wouldn't turn off. In another room the smoke detector fell off the wall, him someone in the head and had no batteries or connection to the wall. The railings outside were very loose and the metal stairway was cracked, leaning and very wet!! There were three teams staying there and I know none of them will ever stay there again. There were much nicer places with comparable rates on the same block.

data.title: Avoid this place, but just for now
data.text: The one thing people need to know is that this property is under new ownership and will be extensively remodeled over the coming year. In the meantime, we recommend you avoid it. The upstairs rooms may be better, but the plumbing is pretty bad on the ground floor - leaky faucets especially. The bathtub was a real hazard because there was no non-slip protection. When I pointed this out to the front desk, the young clerk did not seem at all interested in even passing the information on to management., despite my use of the phrase "lawsuit waiting to happen". The website says they have a pool, but they don't and won't have one until next year at the earliest. In the meantime, you're invited to go use the pool at a place down the street. There is a cheerful lobby and breakfast room; the continental breakfast is standard, but good. This is very much a hit or miss experience  -- our fellow travelers had a little fridge in their room, which we didn't, but their shower didn't work, and ours did.

data.title: Better choices in the Grand Junction / I-70 area
data.text: Hard beds, very out of date room (70's I guess).  For the price, there are much better options in the Horizon Drive / I-70 area.  We live about 2.5 hours from GJ, and will not be staying there again.  By the way, the #'s on the rooms are tiny and it took forever just to find the room.  Weird.  One good thing:  great water pressure in the shower.
